title: upgrade to 6.0.0 went wrong, owncloud remains unusable
body:
hi,

owncloud gets updated automatically via the rpm repository. now this morning owncloud was updated to 6.0.0 which went terribly wrong.

the "updater" exited with
```
an exception occurred while executing 'alter table `oc_appconfig` add primary key (`appid`, `configkey`)': sqlstate[23000]: integrity constraint violation: 1062 duplicate entry 'user_ldap-ldap_backup_host' for key 'primary'
the update was unsuccessful. please report this issue to the owncloud community.
```
owncloud did not remain in maintenance mode, though.
i resolved the duplicate key issue in oc_appconfig manually (there were multiple empty default values) and did the alter table from above.

i don't have a clue on how to rerun the database upgrade. obviously, there must be some open tasks, because when i try to log in i get:
```
an exception occurred while executing 'select `fileid`, `storage`, `path`, `parent`, `name`, `mimetype`, `mimepart`, `size`, `mtime`, `storage_mtime`, `encrypted`, `unencrypted_size`, `etag` from `oc_filecache` where `storage` = ? and `path_hash` = ?': sqlstate[42s22]: column not found: 1054 unknown column 'storage_mtime' in 'field list'
```

please help me resolving this.

kind regards,

phil
